bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Wilbur A. Sawyer, July 24, 1947

div1.p: Hench writes that he will keep Sawyer informed of progress on the Camp Lazear memorial and is glad that Sawyer agrees that Finlay should also be honored.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Wilbur A. Sawyer, July 24, 1947
div1.opener:
July 24, 1947
Dr. Wilbur A. Sawyer
3927 Idaho Avenue
Washington, D. C.
My dear Dr. Sawyer:
div1.p:
I appreciate very greatly your kind letter of July 13th
with the letter of introduction to Mr. Packard. I assure you
that I will not presume on my brief acquaintance with you and
will not embarrass you in any way with Mr. Packard--indeed, I
will not use your letter for the time being but expect to be in
New York in the fall and in due time will write to Mr. Packard
in an attempt to make an appointment. I shall keep you informed
of my progress. I entirely agree with you that the honor must
go, not only to the Americans, but also to Finlay and it has
been my hope that the memorial could be called the Cuban-
American Memorial, honoring Finlay as well as Walter Reed and
his colleagues.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alp
